title: Cat. 26  Portrait of Stéphane Mallarmé, 1891
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Portrait of Stéphane Mallarmé  
1891  
Etching, with drypoint and engraving, in black ink, with pen and black and brown ink, and brush and black and gray wash, on cream wove paper; 149 × 115 mm  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of the Gecht family, 2015.255  
Guérin 13, Kornfeld 12 I/IV

Portrait of Stéphane Mallarmé  
1891, printed 1919  
Etching, with drypoint and engraving, in brown-black ink, on cream laid Japanese paper; 183 × 145 mm (plate); 330 × 240 mm (sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, the Albert H. Wolf Memorial Collection, 1935.46  
Guérin 14, Kornfeld 12 II/IV B,b

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">There is a proof of the etching in a private collection dedicated to Mallarmé and dated January 1891 by Gauguin: “au poete Mallarmé Témoignage d’une très grande admiration. Paul Gauguin. Jer 1891.” See Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine E. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 39, cat. 12.

An edition of 79 copies was printed posthumously in brown on Japanese paper, sixty of which were included in the 1919 edition by Charles Morice, Gauguin (H. Floury, 1919). The Art Institute’s copy is number 64/79.

</section><section id="figures">Left, Portrait of Stéphane Mallarmé, 1891 (cat. 26.1). Right, Portrait of Stéphane Mallarmé, 1891, printed 1919 (cat. 26.2).

</section>
